briefTitle: Comparison of Sternal Wound Infiltration With Liposomal Bupivacaine v. Bupivacaine Hydrochloride

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Open cardiac surgery through sternotomy approach (eg. coronary artery bypass graft, valvular heart procedures, as well as other open cardiac procedures along with coronary artery bypass)
* Surgery with the use of cardiopulmonary bypass

Exclusion Criteria:

* Minimally invasive heart surgery through thoracotomy approach
* Patient undergoing procedures under deep hypothermic circulatory arrest
* Patients with active infections such as infective endocarditis
* Emergency surgery
* Patients undergoing transplantations and ventricular assist device insertion
* Patients on any mechanical circulatory support preoperatively
* Patient's refusal
* End stage liver or renal disease
* Allergy to bupivacaine
* Patient who cannot understand the study procedure or refuse to participate
* Redo-sternotomy
* Participation in another study
* Patients with severe right or left ventricular dysfunction (EF\< 25%)
* Patients requiring chronic opioids for chronic pain condition

outcomeMeasures.title: Post-operative Pain Intensity
outcomeMeasures.description: Postoperative pain scores evaluated by numeric rating scale or (NRS) where 0- no pain and 10- worst pain, at rest and at movement

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Narcotic Consumption
outcomeMeasures.description: All narcotics administered in the first 0-8, 8-24, 24-48, and 48-72 hours and the total narcotics administered in the 0-72 hours postoperative period(PCA narcotics, nurse-administered IV narcotics, and oral narcotics). All narcotics will be converted to total IV morphine equivalent for comparison between two groups.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Extubation
outcomeMeasures.description: The time it takes until the patient is extubated post-operatively will be measured

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Time to Mobilization
outcomeMeasures.description: The time it takes until patient ambulates will be measured

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Time to Out of Bed to Chair
outcomeMeasures.description: The time it takes until the patient advances from bedrest to out of bed (OOB) to chair will be measured

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Time to Oral Intake
outcomeMeasures.description: The time it takes until the patient is able to/medically cleared to consume food or liquid will be measured

outcomeMeasures.title: Non-invasive Ventilation (NIV) Requirement
outcomeMeasures.description: Episodes of NIV such as upper airway masks or similar devices will be quantified

outcomeMeasures.title: Re-intubation
outcomeMeasures.description: Instances of re-intubation will be recorded

outcomeMeasures.title: Use of Incentive Spirometry
outcomeMeasures.description: Frequency of incentive spirometry will be measured

outcomeMeasures.title: Post-operative Nausea and Vomiting
outcomeMeasures.description: Whether a patient experiences at least one episode of nausea and emesis will be measured

outcomeMeasures.title: Major Organ Dysfunction
outcomeMeasures.description: Organ systems such as cardiac, renal, respiratory, and nervous system failure/dysfunction in accordance with the Society of Thoracic Surgeon's database will be noted

outcomeMeasures.title: Length of Hospital and ICU Stay
outcomeMeasures.description: Length of both hospital and ICU stay will be measured

outcomeMeasures.title: Hospital Readmission
outcomeMeasures.description: Readmission to hospital will be noted

outcomeMeasures.title: Mortality
outcomeMeasures.description: Mortality will be noted at specific timepoints

outcomeMeasures.title: Delirium
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients will be assessed for delirium using the Intensive Care Delirium Screening Checklist (ICDSC)

outcomeMeasures.title: Delirium
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients will be assessed for delirium using the Intensive Care Delirium Screening Checklist (ICDSC)

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Satisfaction
outcomeMeasures.description: Patient will give an assessment regarding pain management on a scale of 0 - 10 with 0 indicating the lowest satisfaction with pain management and 10 indicating the highest satisfaction with pain management

outcomeMeasures.title: Chronic Pain Assessment
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjects will be asked the two following questions: "Are you currently experiencing pain?" as well as "Are you experiencing moderate to severe pain?" with moderate to severe indicated as a pain score of 4-10 on 0 to 10 scale, with 0 being no pain at all and 10 being the worst pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Chronic Pain Assessment
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjects will be asked the two following questions: "Are you currently experiencing pain?" as well as "Are you experiencing moderate to severe pain?" with moderate to severe indicated as a pain score of 4-10 on 0 to 10 scale, with 0 being no pain at all and 10 being the worst pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Serum Cortisol Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: Stress response suppression as a result of treatment will be evaluated by comparing hormone levels between the groups. Serum cortisol levels will be taken to measure this.
